ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I became proficient in Italian. I learned most of the necessary grammar structures and about 1200 vocabulary words. I also watched several Italian films and learned about the nation's unique culture.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This course would be improved if it were an hour and a half a day instead of nearly two hours, which is unbearable. None of us could concentrate for that long.

Strengths:

Not a huge work load outside of the classroom and small classroom size (5 people Fall 2017) make it a very good opportunity to learn a language with a great professor. The class really becomes very personal.

Weaknesses:

High intensity during class and tests often, but that's to be expected with an intensive language

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, if you are really determined to become fluent in Italian in as little time as possible. This class is two credits for a reason! Be prepared to spend almost two hours a day in class, and each week to do online homework, memorize about 120 vocabulary words and a couple of grammar concepts, and write a short essay (a couple of paragraphs). Since I love languages and really wanted to learn Italian, I had a lot of fun, but definitely had to put in the effort to prepare for all the exams-- ten regular exams and the 3-hour final.

This course is fantastic but only if you're willing to put in the work to study for it. This is a class where you get out of it what you put into it, but Professor Iacovella is there to guide you through everything. I highly recommend it because of how small the class is and how personalized it becomes, something that's very beneficial to have in a language class.
